title: Nintendo Switch — Buyer changed mind

listingInfo.title: Nintendo Switch (Standard Model) – Runs smoothly, complete accessories
listingInfo.attributes: Main console, JoyCon, Dock, charging cable; no repairs; screen normal; JoyCon has no drift.

complaint: Buyer says the item is fully functional but they ‘don’t like it / not used to it’ and requests a return. This is Buyer’s Change of Mind — not SNAD.

chatLog.text: Hi~ is the console still available?
Yes.
Does it run smoothly? I want to see if I can get used to it.
Very smooth. I played Zelda and Mario with no issues.
Does the JoyCon drift? I heard many have that problem.
This one doesn't drift. I just had it serviced.
Can you do 4,300?
4,400 for you.
OK. Please ship via 7-11 COD to Zhongxiao Xinsheng.
Okay, I'll ship this afternoon.
Order created – Order ID: TW-14012
Shipped.
Package has arrived at the store.
I picked it up and paid NT$4,060.
I received the console. Everything works fine. But… after trying it, I feel it’s not the type of gameplay I imagined. I’m not really used to it. Can I return it?

As long as there’s no defect, I can’t accept a return just because it’s ‘not suitable.’ Electronics returns are troublesome and risky. I also stated in the listing that I don’t accept returns due to change of preference.
I understand… I’m just not used to it.
I completely understand, but since there's no issue at all, returning it means I absorb the entire loss. So I really can’t take it back.
Buyer submitted a return/refund request. Reason: ‘Does not meet needs / Not used to it.’
Seller selected ‘Reject return.’ Reason: ‘Not SNAD / Buyer changed mind.’
